EXECTUIVE SUMMARY

Saputo Cheese USA Inc. has developed a Risk Management Program (RMP) in accordance with 
the standards of the Environmental Protection Agency (EPA) (40 CFR Part 68) and California 
Accidental Release Prevention (CalARP) Program (CCR, Title 19, Division 2, Chapter 4.5).  
Saputo's RMP is comprised of the following sections which are summarized below.

1. Accidental release prevention and emergency response policies
2. Stationary source and the regulated substances handled
3. General accidental release prevention program and chemical-specific prevention
4. Five-year accident history
5. Emergency response program
6. Planned changes to improve safety
7. Seismic assessment


1.  ACCIDENTAL RELEASE PREVENTION AND EMERGENCY RESPONSE POLICIES

Saputo is strongly committed to employee, public and environmental safety through a 
comprehensive accidental release prevention program that covers areas such as design, installation, 
operating procedures, maintenance, and employee training associated with the processes at our 
facility.  It is our policy to implement appropriate controls to prevent possible releases of regulated 
substances.  If such a release does occur, we are coordinated with the Los Angeles County Fire 
Department which provides emergency response expertise.


2.  STATIONARY SOURCE AND REGULATED SUBSTANCES HANDLED

The facility's primary activity encompasses cheese manufacturing.  The plant is located at 
5611 East Imperial Highway in South Gate, California.  There is one RMP-regulated substance, 
anhydrous ammonia, used at the plant to provide refrigeration for production and warehousing.  
The maximum intended inventory of ammonia at the facility is approximately 7,400 pounds.


3.  GENERAL ACCIDENTAL RELEASE AND CHEMICAL-SPECIFIC PREVENTION

The following sections briefly describe the elements of the release prevention program that is in 
place at our facility.



Safety Information

Saputo maintains a detailed record of safety information

that describes the chemical hazards, 
operating parameters and equipment designs associated with the refrigeration process.

Hazard Review

The facility has conducted a hazard review to ensure that hazards associated with the processes are 
identified and controlled efficiently.  The methodology used to carry out these analyses is a 
combination of the HAZOP study and the What-If/Checklist.  The study is undertaken by a team of 
qualified personnel with expertise in engineering and process operations and shall be revalidated at 
a regular interval of five years or when changes dictate.  Any findings related to the hazard review 
shall be addressed in a timely manner.

Operating Procedures

For the purposes of safely conducting activities within our covered processes, Saputo maintains 
written standard operating procedures (SOP).  These procedures address various modes of 
operation such as initial startup, normal operations, temporary operations, emergency shutdown, 
emergency operations, normal shutdown and startup after a turnaround for each system component.  
The information shall be regularly reviewed and readily accessible to operators involved in the 
processes.

Training

Saputo has a comprehensive training program in place to ensure that operators are competent in the 
operating procedures associated with these processes.  Refresher training shall be provided at least 
once every three years and more frequently as needed.  All training shall be validated and 
documented for each employee.

Maintenance

Saputo has developed written maintenance procedures for process equipment to ensure proper 
operation.  Process equipment examined includes pressure vessels, piping systems, relief and vent 
systems, emergency shutdown systems, controls and pumps.  Maintenance shall be performed by 
qualified personnel who have the appropriate training suited to their responsibilities.  Any 
identified equipment deficiencies are corrected in a safe and timely manner.

Compli

ance Audits

These audits shall be carried out at least once every three (3) years to determine whether the 
provisions set out under the RMP rule are being implemented.  Any corrective actions required as a 
result of the audits shall be undertaken in a safe and prompt manner.



Incident Investigation

Saputo promptly investigates any incident that has resulted in, or could reasonably result in, a 
catastrophic release.  These investigations are conducted to identify the situation leading to the 
incident as well as any corrective actions to prevent a future release.  All reports are retained for a 
minimum of five (5) years.


4.  FIVE-YEAR ACCIDENT HISTORY

Saputo Cheese USA has had a good record of preventing accidental releases over the last five 
years.  Due to our stringent release prevention policies, no incidents have occurred in the past five 
years.


5.  EMERGENCY RESPONSE PLAN

Saputo developed an Emergency Action Plan to deal with accidental releases of hazardous 
materials.  The plan includes all aspects of emergency response including adequate first aid and 
medical treatment, evacuations, notification of local emergency response agencies and the public, 
as well as post-incident decontamination of affected areas.


6.  PLANNED CHANGES TO IMPROVE SAFETY

Several developments and findings have resulted from the implementation of the various elements 
of our accidental release prevention program.  Recommendations resulting from hazard review will 
be addressed in a timely manner.


7.  SEISMIC ASSESSMENT

As part of the State's CalARP program, Saputo is required to conduct a seismic assessment to 
evaluate the structural integrity of the refrigeration system.  The findings from the study shall be 
used to improve the system in order to prevent a release of ammonia with offsite consequences in 
the event of an earthquake.
